articles.title: Curriculum Vitae
articles.description: Qudus Uthman - Department of Crop and Soil Sciences, NCSU.
articles.contents:
INTEREST
Water, Nutrients, and Pesticides Management;
Vadose zone hydrology;
Environmental Soil Physics and Ecohydrology;
Soil and Water Conservation and Management;
System Thinking Approach
Data Analysis
EDUCATION
2023 – PhD Soil, Water, and Ecosystems Sciences,
University of Florida, Gainesville, FL. |
Hydrologic Sciences Concentration |
PhD Minor in Statistics |
Certificate in Biological Systems Modelling.
2019 – MSc Soil and Water Sciences,
University of Florida, Gainesville, FL.
2014 – B. Agric. (First Class, summa cum laude equivalent) |
Soil Science and Land Management,
Federal University of Agriculture Abeokuta,
Nigeria.
PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT AND TRAINING
2022 – DSSAT Model International Training Program May
16-21st
2021 – Two-day HYDRUS short course, March 16-17th
2018 – Teaching pedagogy and teaching with technology by
teaching center of the University of Florida
Graduate School
PROFESSIONAL EXPERIENCE
2023 – Till Date: Post Doctoral Researcher, Department of Crop and
Soil Sciences, North Carolina State University
Raleigh, NC.
2017 – 2023: Graduate assistant, Soil, Water, and
Ecosystem Sciences Department, Institute
of Food and Agricultural Sciences,
University of Florida, Gainesville, FL.
2016 – 2017: Federal Government of Nigeria Npower
agricultural services program at Ogun State
Agricultural Development Program, Abeokuta,
Nigeria.
2015 – 2016: National Youth Service Corps at Ladoke Akintola
University of Technology Ogbomosho, Nigeria.
2012 – 2013: Intern at Odogbolu rural community
settlement, Community-Based Farming Scheme,
Federal University of Agriculture, Abeokuta,
Nigeria.
2011 - 2012: Intern at Organic Agriculture for Tertiary
Institution in Nigeria, Federal University of
Agriculture, Abeokuta, Nigeria.

articles.title: Fertilizer Recommendation Support Tool
articles.description:
Post Doctoral Research Scholar | 
Department of Crop and Soil Sciences | 
North Carolina State University (NCSU).
articles.contents:
The soil testing and nutrient management process - BFDC

Fertilizer recommendation support tool - A similar concept of making better fertilizer decisions for cropping systems in Australia (BFDC)
